meanings.sent1: The skirl of the wind through the trees filled the forest with an eerie sound.
meanings.sent2: The bagpipes emitted a loud skirl that echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The skirl of the tea kettle on the stove made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The skirl of the ambulance siren pierced through the busy city streets.
meanings.sent5: The skirl of the seagulls overhead added to the seaside atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To make a shrill, wailing sound
meanings.sent1: The little girl began to skirl loudly when she dropped her ice cream cone.
meanings.sent2: The wind started to skirl through the cracks in the old window frames.
meanings.sent3: The teapot seemed to skirl in protest as it reached boiling point.
meanings.sent4: The toddler's skirling cry could be heard throughout the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The cat skirled in distress when it got stuck in the tree.

meanings.sent1: The skirl of the whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent2: The skirl of the bird's call cut through the quiet morning air.
meanings.sent3: The skirl of the car alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The skirl of the violin added a haunting quality to the music.
meanings.sent5: The skirl of the kettle boiling could be heard from the next room.
